intro: Anthemis cupaniana, commonly known as the cupaniopsis goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas. Its yellow flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in a spherical shape. The leaves are usually narrow and covered with fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
